abstract_summ: AIM: The aim was to explore the psychological impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on Italian pregnant women, especially regarding concerns and birth expectations.This study attempted to assess the knowledge, attitude, anxiety experience, and perceived mental healthcare need among adult Indian population during the COVID-19 pandemic.CONCLUSIONS: Women’s expectations and concerns regarding childbirth changed significantly as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy.There is a need to intensify the awareness and address the mental health issues of people during this COVID-19 pandemic.In this study, sleep difficulties, paranoia about acquiring COVID-19 infection and distress related social media were reported in 12.5 %, 37.8 %, and 36.4 % participants respectively.
title_summ: Pregnant women voice their concerns and birth expectations during the COVID-19 pandemic in ItalyQuarantine Fatigue: first-ever decrease in social distancing measures after the COVID-19 outbreak before reopening United StatesStudy of knowledge, attitude, anxiety & perceived mental healthcare need in Indian population during COVID-19 pandemicThe Impact of COVID-19 Epidemic Declaration on Psychological Consequences: A Study on Active Weibo Users
title_abstract_phrases: AIM: The aim was to explore the psychological impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on Italian pregnant women, especially regarding concerns and birth expectations.Pregnant women voice their concerns and birth expectations during the COVID-19 pandemic in ItalyBACKGROUND: In March 2020, COVID-19 was declared to be a pandemic.Quarantine Fatigue: first-ever decrease in social distancing measures after the COVID-19 outbreak before reopening United StatesBy the emergence of the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in Wuhan, China, and its rapid outbreak worldwide, the infectious illness has changed our everyday travel patterns.Study of knowledge, attitude, anxiety & perceived mental healthcare need in Indian population during COVID-19 pandemicNovel Corona Virus Disease (COVID-19) originating from China has rapidly crossed borders, infecting people throughout the whole world.CONCLUSIONS: Women’s expectations and concerns regarding childbirth changed significantly as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy.
